I am working on formalizing one of the proof in the baby rudin and this theorem is involved so I decided to formalize it as well. I found out that the r_p will be used in the definition of set G. Accroding to the conditions I have, I think I need to seal the statement hV to a function r(p) Or in terms of the variables in lean, it's the ε(x) I need from the hV. what is the code for that?

Try have hV2 (x : V i) := Classical.indefiniteDescription (hV x.val x.prop), which you can use like (hV2 ⟨x, hx⟩).val : ℝ and (hV2 ⟨x, hx⟩).prop : (hV2 ⟨x, hx⟩).val > 0 ∧ Metric.ball x (hV2 ⟨x, hx⟩).val ⊆ V i where x : X and hx : x ∈ V i.
The reason Classical.axiomOfChoice didn't work is, hV is technically a double-forall quantified statement "forall x, forall proofs that x ∈ V i, there exists ...", which did not match the single-forall quantified statement that Classical.axiomOfChoice expects.
Have you tried the tactic choose ε hε using hV?
